alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gallatin; Hamilton; Jefferson; Johnson; Perry; Pope; Saline; Union; Wayne; White; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 5:42AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Perry, western White, eastern Union, Wayne, northern Pope, Jefferson, northern Johnson, Williamson, Saline, Hamilton, Franklin and northwestern Gallatin Counties through 630 AM CST... At 541 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ashley to near Carbondale to near Jonesboro. Movement was northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Carterville around 545 AM CST. Herrin, Zeigler, Crainville, Royalton, Energy and Woodlawn around 550 AM CST. Mount Vernon, West Frankfort, Johnston City, Christopher, Goreville and West City around 555 AM CST. Benton, Creal Springs, Thompsonville and Lake Of Egypt Area around 600 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Carrier Mills, Harrisburg, Mcleansboro, Galatia, Eldorado, Enfield and Norris City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 11. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 28 and 105. Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 63 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Gallatin; Hamilton; Jefferson; Johnson; Perry; Pope; Saline; Union; Wayne; White; Williamson
